alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:53PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 453 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tererro, or 15 miles east of Santa Fe, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Tererro, Upper Colonias and Glorieta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 302 and 307. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
